title: Analyst Interview
Interview Descriptions: Three to four stages of interview process beginning with quantitative reasoning. Then first stage interview where you will be asked situational and analysis based questions. Basically the same types of questions till the 4th stage.
Interview Questions: Analysis based questions and situation based questions

title: Analyst Interview
Interview Descriptions: It was a nice interview with a brain teaser at the beginning and case studies at the end. The case studies were aligned to my background but tough as usual
Interview Questions: How much will people in Abuja save if petrol subsidy was fully removed over the next year

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Solina Group (Nigeria) (Abuja, Federal Capital Territory) in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: A first class student from any discipline is eligible to apply for an internship with Solina. There are two interview stages for an internship position: arithmetic exam and an interview using case study questions
Interview Questions: How many cars can be parked in a parking space built on a space the size of a standard football field?

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Solina Group (Nigeria) in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: Included a quantitative assessment of about 30 different questions with no options so you would have to input your answer yourself and after that process, there would be a group interview process with other applicants present
Interview Questions: Analytical questions about a specific individual

title: Internship Interview
Interview Descriptions: Great. I had an online assessment. I mistakenly logged out and couldn't get back into the test. The website was easy to use and the questions weren't bad. I wrote quantitative reasoning and a little bit of abstract. There were 30 questions in total

title: Program Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Solina Group (Nigeria) (Kano, Kano) in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions:
Come prepared: You will be given 24hrs notice, so you the time to do your research and prepared appropriately.  

What to expect: Questions asked are case study questions. 

Interview expectation: Make sure to provide good assumptions in solution development, maintain some stamina under pressure, and have good quantitative skills.

Feedback: Provide feedback on the interviewers and interview in general
Interview Questions:
Budgeting - Commodities consumptions and computation.
Quick Maths - % difference and computation 
Riddles - Logical approach

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Solina Group (Nigeria) (Abuja, Niger)
Interview Descriptions: Firstly, Applicant will take a computer based aptitude test. If successful candidate proceeds to the case interview with a manager and then a final case interview with a principal. It is a rigorous process and candidates need to thoroughly prepare.
Interview Questions: market sizing questions ensure to use good assumptions and issue tree (If you can)

title: Clinical Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Solina Group (Nigeria) (Abuja, Federal Capital Territory) in Nov 2020
Interview Descriptions:
The first stage was a Quantitative Assessment Test, which was computer and time based.
The second stage was a virtual personal
 experience and case type interview.
That was my last stage.
Interview Questions: I was asked to give a brief description of myself

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Solina Group (Nigeria) (Abuja, Federal Capital Territory)
Interview Descriptions: The interview process involved a computer based test consisting of 30 questions and then the actual interview in person. Only after passing the test will you get an invite. The test is basically to test your quantitative reasoning as it involves simple mathematical equations and analysis.
Interview Questions: Given a said problem how would you go about it?

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Solina Group (Nigeria) (Abuja, Federal Capital Territory) in May 2020
Interview Descriptions:
The interview is in 4 stages
1. Computer based test: Quantitiative reasoning questions that test your math and reasoning skills. 30 questions in 30 minutes
2. Case Interviews: These are the next 3 stages with higher cadre of employees culminating with an interview with the CEO.
Interview Questions: How would you solve a certain public health problem?

title: Senior Associate I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 8 months. I interviewed at Solina Group (Nigeria) (Abuja, Federal Capital Territory) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: 4 different group Interviews with critical thinking based scenario questions. If you pass one stage you move to the next stage. You will get immediate feedback after the interview how you perform. It took about 2-3 weeks interval between stages.
Interview Questions: What is the budget of a 'just described' project? Use the board.

title: NYSC Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Solina Group (Nigeria) (Abuja, Niger) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: While in camp, you'll typically get a phone call scheduling you for a routine visit with the company representatives. You'll be administered the test on site...20 questions 30 minutes. All analytical questions and no calculator allowed. Few days later, you'll get a call (if you passed the test) and during this time be questioned on some select topics.
Interview Questions: Do you have good analytical skills?

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Solina Group (Nigeria) (Abuja, Federal Capital Territory) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: Initial stage includes written quantitative reasoning tests. Dynamic case interviews with different levels of management follow when candidates pass the quantitative reasoning test. Candidates progress to case interviews with a higher level of management based on performance in each stage.
Interview Questions: Questions are not static and change with every candidate
